titles.title: Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" / Miscellaneous texts

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" (fols. 6r-74r) I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah and hymns (fols. 6r-14v) I-2) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 32 miracles (fols. 15r-73v) I-3) ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi ... "Does not the man ..." (distributed among the miracles of Mary, fols. 17v-74r) II) Miscellaneous texts (fols. 74r-104v, 108r) II-1) Sǝbḥat läki Maryam bä-ḫwǝlqwä kwǝllu śǝʿǝrtǝyä ... "Glory to you, Mary, as numerous as my hair ..." (fol. 74r) II-2) Sälam sälam lä-zǝkrä sǝmǝki bä-ʾammǝḫa ... "Salutation salutation to the remembrance of your name with greetings ..." (fols. 74v-76r) (cp. ChRep no. 221) II-3) Homily by Timothy (Dämatewos), Patriarch of Alexandria [for the 12th of Ḫǝdar] (fols. 77r-90v) II-4) Yǝweddǝsǝwwa mälaʾǝkt lä-Maryam ... "The angels praise Mary ..." (fols. 93r-95r) (cp. ChRep no. 388) II-5) Sälam läki Maryam lä-Noḫ ḥamäru ... "Salutation to you Mary, Noah's Ark ..." (fols. 95r-98r) (cp. ChRep no. 88) II-6) Täfäśśǝḥi Maryam dǝngǝltä śǝga wä-ḥǝllina ... "Rejoice, Mary, Virgin in body and mind ..." (fols. 98v-102r) (cp. ChRep no. 303) II-7) O rǝḫrǝḫtä ḥǝllina ... "O tender-hearted ..." (fols. 102r-104v) (cp. ChRep no. 368) II-8) Excerpt from Missal (ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሥሉስ፡ ዘኢይትነገር፡ ሀበኒ፡ ...) (fol. 108r)
Additiones 1-2.

copyists.copyist: Hand b resembles the hands in AADM-005, QDS-007, RQG-003.

donors.donor: The names of the original donors have been erased from the supplication formulas and replaced with those of Zä-Wäldä Maryam, Mäʿaza Giyorgis and others (written in hand a).

dcomments.dcomment: 18th cent. (?) Quire II is of a more recent time (19th cent.).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. was resewn. The leather cover has been cut off from the spine.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover is poorly visible.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible at the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: I(5; s.l.: 3, stub after 2/fols. 1r-5v) – <II(9; s.l.: 9, stub before 1/fols. 6r-14v)> – III(8/fols. 15r-22v) – ፪IV(8/fols. 23r-30v) – ፫V(8/fols. 31r-38v) – ፬VI(8/fols. 39r-46v) – ፭VII(8/fols. 47r-54v) – ፮VIII(8/fols. 55r-62v) – ፯IX(8/fols. 63r-70v) –፰X(6/fols. 71r-76v) – XI(8/fols. 77r-84v) – XII(8/fols. 85r-92v) – XIII(8/fols. 93r-100v) – XIV(8/fols. 101r-110v)

taunit.mr-info: Quire II: all data are for fol. 7r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Quires I, III-XIII: all data are for fol. 16r.
taunit.rl-info:
Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The scribe did not use the bottom ruled line on fols. 34v-36r, 39r-46r. Ruling of frame-type on fols. 101, 110.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Hand a: 19th century; hand b: 18th century (?).

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre; hand b: fine and careful.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 6r-14v; irregularly formed, right-sloping letters with short hairlines. Hand b: fols. 15r-104v, 108r; neat and regular, with upright broadly spaced letters. The quality changes significantly to the very end of Text II-7 (fol. 104r-v). ጵ has a modern shape, with the 6th order marker set on the upper vertical line, directed to the right.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I-2; incipit of all other texts, incipit of (sub)sections of texts and section numbers of Text I-2; first word of each strophe of Texts I-3, II-2, II-6, II-7; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
All miracles of Mary are numbered.
Text I-1 includes the hymns: - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam Mariham ʾǝmmu lä-ʾәgziʾǝnä ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali ... "O my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of our Lord, Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (fol. 11v) (cp. ChRep no. 373) - Sälam läki ʾo-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn wä-ʾǝmmä bǝrhan ... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (fols. 11v l.18-13r). - a shorter version of Ṣälotä zä-yǝbl ʾǝmqǝdmä yanbǝbu täʾamriha lä-ʾәgzǝʾtǝnä Maryam ... "Prayer recited before reading the Miracles of Mary ..." (fol. 14v) - Excerpt from the Gospel of John (Jn. 19:25-27) (fol. 14v).
Text II-2 is also known as Mälkǝʿa ʾEdom "Image of Edom". Text II-3 is the first homily from Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel. Text II-7 is known as Mälkǝʿa śǝʿǝl "Image of the Icon" within the Mälkǝʿa gubaʾe "Collection of Images".

additional.cont: Fols. 2r-3r: ˀƎsäggəd läki wä-ˀəweddəsäki... "I worship Thee..."
additional.det: The hymn is written in a poor hand and appears in an uneven script.

additional.cont: Fols. 104v-107r: Introductory exhortation and hymn.
additional.det: The exhortation, written in hand a, includes the hymn: ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam dǝngǝl bä-kǝlʾe wäladitä ʾamlak ... "O my Lady, Two-fold Virgin Mary, Godbearing ..." (fols. 106v-107r)

extras.extra: - Remains of a modern pictures: fol. 4v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Undecorated quire marks are written in the left upper margin of fols.: 15r: ፩(?), 23r: ፪, 31r: ፫, 39r: ፬, 47r: ፭, 55r: ፮, 63r: ፯, 71r: ፰.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Note ዘቀዳሚት፡ ወዘመላእክት, written in the upper margin of fol. 11v, indicates the occasion of reading. - Coloured threads are inserted into fols. 44, 46, 51, 56, 62, 91, 98, 109.

miniature.info: Fol. 3v: St. George slaying the dragon.
Fol. 4r: The Virgin and Child with the archangels Michel and Gabriel; a prone male figure below (donor?).
miniature.details: Legend: ሚካኤል፡ "Michael". [ማርያም፡] ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ ፡ "[Mary] with her beloved Son". ገብርኤል፡ "Gabriel".
Legend: ብፁዕ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ዘቆመ፡ በአሐቲ፡ እግሩ፡ ፯ዓመት። "The blessed Täklä Haymanot who stood on his one foot for seven years".
